title: Military and Government Leaders
summary: David organizes Israel’s army into monthly divisions and appoints leaders over tribes, treasuries, and agricultural work. This chapter shows David’s administrative skill and the structured leadership of Israel.

faq.question: How was the army organized?
faq.answer: Into twelve divisions of 24,000 men, each serving one month per year.

faq.question: What areas did David appoint officials over?
faq.answer: Military, tribal leadership, treasuries, farming, vineyards, flocks, and counselors.
